legacy.name: System.Messaging
legacy.reason: MSMQ is Windows-specific and not available in .NET Core/5+
legacy.replacement: Azure Service Bus, RabbitMQ, or Azure Storage Queues

legacy.name: System.ServiceProcess
legacy.reason: Windows Service infrastructure not directly available in .NET Core/5+

legacy.name: System.Configuration.Install
legacy.reason: Windows Service installer not needed for containerized apps

legacyPatterns.description: Application uses Windows Service base class (ServiceBase)
legacyPatterns.modernization: Convert to Worker Service using Microsoft.Extensions.Hosting
Replace with Azure Service Bus or Azure Storage Queues for cloud compatibility
Remove - not needed for containerized deployment

legacyPatterns.description: Uses legacy project format with explicit file references

blockers: MSMQ dependency requires Windows and cannot run in Linux containers
Windows Service infrastructure not compatible with container orchestration
No graceful shutdown handling for containers
recommendations: Replace MSMQ with Azure Service Bus for cloud-native messaging
Convert Windows Service to Worker Service

complexity.reasoning: High complexity due to Windows-specific dependencies (MSMQ, Windows Service) requiring architectural changes. MSMQ replacement with Azure Service Bus requires significant refactoring. Windows Service to Worker Service conversion is well-documented but requires infrastructure changes. Deployment to Azure Container Apps requires containerization and cloud-native patterns.

phases.name: Messaging Infrastructure
tasks: Replace MSMQ with Azure Service Bus
Add Azure Service Bus client SDK

risks: MSMQ to Azure Service Bus migration may reveal behavioral differences
Queue creation and management differs between MSMQ and Azure Service Bus
Cost implications of Azure Service Bus need consideration

immediate: Set up Azure Service Bus namespace for testing
Review message processing requirements and SLAs
Identify any MSMQ-specific features in use
Plan testing strategy for message processing
beforeMigration: Back up existing MSMQ messages if needed
Document current message flow and processing
Set up development environment with Azure Service Bus

summary.feasibility: High - Migration is feasible but requires significant architectural changes
summary.effort: Medium-High - Estimated 17 hours of development work
benefits: Better scalability with Azure Container Apps
considerations: MSMQ to Azure Service Bus is the primary complexity driver
Will require changes to message producers if any
Testing effort to validate message processing equivalence
